Detailed Description

Definitions for atomic operations.

Define Documentation

#define CTK_ATOMIC_EA ( atomic_var   )     ((ctk_atomic_ea_t)(unsigned long)(&(atomic_var)))

A macro to get an atomic EA for the given atomic variable.

Parameters:
[in] atomic_var - an atomic variable (ctk_atomic_t)

#define CTK_ATOMIC_PTR ( atomic_ea   )     ((ctk_atomic_t*)(unsigned long)(atomic_ea))

A macro to get a pointer to the atomic variable from the given atomic reference.

Parameters:
[in] atomic_ea - an atomic reference (ctk_atomic_ea_t)

#define CTK_ATOMIC_PTR64 ( atomic_ea   )     ((ctk_atomic64_t*)(unsigned long)(atomic_ea))

A macro to get a pointer to a 64-bit atomic variable from the given atomic reference.

Parameters:
[in] atomic_ea - an atomic reference (ctk_atomic_ea_t)

#define CTK_ATOMIC_VAR ( atomic_ea   )     (*(ctk_atomic_t*)(unsigned long)(atomic_ea))

A macro to get an atomic variable from the given atomic reference.

Parameters:
[in] atomic_ea - an atomic reference (ctk_atomic_ea_t)

#define CTK_ATOMIC_VAR64 ( atomic_ea   )     (*(ctk_atomic64_t*)(unsigned long)(atomic_ea))

A macro to get a 64-bit atomic variable from the given atomic reference.

Parameters:
[in] atomic_ea - an atomic reference (ctk_atomic_ea_t)

Typedef Documentation

typedef volatile signed long ctk_atomic64_t __attribute__((aligned(128)))

64-bit atomic type (must be aligned in a 128-bit line)

typedef volatile signed int ctk_atomic_t __attribute__((aligned(128)))

atomic type (must be aligned in a 128-bit line)

typedef ea_addr_t ctk_atomic_ea_t

atomic EA type

long int  oldval,
long int  newval 
) [inline, static]

32 or 64-bit ('addr' size) CAS (compare-and-swap) operation (if (*p == oldval) *p = newval)

int  oldval,
int  newval 
) [inline, static]

32-bit CAS (compare-and-swap) operation (if (*p == oldval) *p = newval)
